title: Africa: United Nations Day Message - 24 October 2023
description: [MINUSMA] The United Nations is a reflection of the world as it is - and an aspiration of the world we know it can be.

title: Africa: Sundowns Seize Control Against Petro in AFL With Vital Away Win
description: [CAF] Mamelodi Sundowns earned a crucial 2-0 first leg victory away to Petro Atletico on Angola in their African Football League (AFL) quarter-final on Saturday.

title: Africa: Mazembe Register Slender Advantage Over Esperance.
description: [CAF] Match Day 3 of the inaugural African Football League produced yet another tense affair at the Benjamin Mkwapa National Stadium in Dar er Salaam, Tanzania, as TP Mazembe registered a hard-fought 1 - 0 victory over Esperance on Sunday afternoon.

title: Africa: Wydad Emerge Victorious in Uyo
description: [CAF] A clinical and composed display by Wydad AC ensured they take home an important 1-0 away victory over Enyimba in the first leg of the African Football League played at the Godswill Akpabio International Stadium in Uyo.

title: Southern Africa: Southern Africa's Security Hinges On Actioning Its Organised Crime Strategy
description: [ISS] The prevalence of trafficking and financial crimes highlights the urgency of better controls and regional cooperation.

title: Africa: Cholera Upsurge (2021-Present)
description: [WHO] After decades of progress against cholera, cases are again on the rise, even in countries that had not seen the disease in years.

title: Africa: African Football League - Enyimba Captain Not Giving Up After 1-0 Loss to Wydad
description: [Premium Times] Enyimba captain is not giving up after the 1-0 home defeat to Wydad, as he believes Enyimba can also travel to Casablanca and win

title: Africa: African Leaders Hear China's Xi Outline 'BRI 2.0'
description: [VOA] Johannesburg -- China and the U.S. presented competing visions for development in Africa this week as several leaders from the continent attended Beijing's Belt and Road Forum marking the 10-year anniversary of the global infrastructure initiative.

title: Africa: Kenyan Teacher Wins African Union's Best Teacher Award
description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Rosemary Bosibori Onyancha, a dedicated teacher at Moi Forces Academy Lanet in Lanet, Nakuru City, Kenya, has been awarded the African Union's Continental Best Teacher Award. Ms. Onyancha was recognized for her exceptional contributions to education, marking her as one of the outstanding teachers on the African continent.

title: Africa: Joint Statement by UNDP, UNFPA, UNICEF, WFP and WHO on Humanitarian Supplies Crossing into Gaza
description: [WHO-AFRO] A first, but limited, shipment of life-saving humanitarian supplies from the United Nations and the Egyptian Red Crescent entered Gaza today on 20 trucks, passing through the Rafah Crossing.

title: Africa: New State of Africa's Environment 2023 Report Warns of Growing Environmental Challenges
description: [Capital FM] Kisii -- The 2023 State of Africa's Environment Report by the Center for Science and Environment (CSE) highlights the growing challenges facing the continent.

title: Africa: Gaza Humanitarian Crisis Worsens Even As First Aid Convoys Arrive
description: [IPS] Cairo, United Nations -- By Hisham Allam and Naureen Hossain

title: Africa: Energy, Mining Account for $7.8bn Deals in Sub-Saharan Africa - Report
description: [Daily Trust] Energy, mining & utilities (EMU) sector saw the highest aggregate deal value in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) in 2022, raking in $7.8 billion out of the $19.2 billion deals in the region, according to a report by KPMG, a top professional service company.

title: Africa: Etienne Sevet - the Many Adventures of the Bongo Hop
description: [Afropop] One of this year's headliners at the International Festival de Nuits Afrique in Montreal this summer was The Bongo Hop.

title: Africa: Explainer - What Is International Humanitarian Law?
description: [UN News] While aid workers serving conflict-affected civilian populations depend on a set of laws to protect them, some warring parties violate these global agreements, from targeting hospitals and schools to blocking aid workers from reaching civilians with lifesaving goods and services.
